Top 5 Best Zodiac Signs in Bed and Their Matching Partners

Top 5 Best Zodiac Signs in Bed and Their Matching Partners

When it comes to zodiac signs, each one has its own unique traits and characteristics.

Their qualities make them stand out in different aspects of life. In romance and intimacy, some zodiac signs are known for being incredibly passionate and skilled in the bedroom. If you're curious about which zodiac signs rank among the best when satisfying their partners, look no further. Here are the top 5 best zodiac signs in bed and their matching partners:

Top 5 Best Zodiac Signs in Bed

Libras are one of the best signs in bed. They are known for their charm, grace, and romantic nature.

1. Libra (September 23–October 22)

Libras are great at creating a harmonious and balanced atmosphere in the bedroom, making their partners feel loved and appreciated. Libras love balance and harmony — in life and their libido. They are also excellent communicators, ensuring both parties' needs and desires are met. Their ideal match partners include Aries, Leo, and Sagittarius.

Scorpios are intense, passionate, and highly sensual individuals. Their magnetic presence draws their partners in and keeps them returning for more.

2. Scorpio (October 23–November 21)

Scorpios are not afraid to explore their deepest desires and fantasies. These features make for an exciting and fulfilling sexual experience. Their ideal match partners include Cancer, Pisces, and Virgo.

3. Leo (July 23 – August 22)

Leos are known for their fiery passion and confidence in the bedroom. They love to be the center of attention and shower their partners with affection and adoration. Leos are adventurous and love trying new things to keep the spark alive in their relationships. They are compatible with Aries, Sagittarius, and Gemini as their match partners.

Geminis are playful, curious, and adaptable lovers. Their natural charm and wit make them exciting and engaging partners in the bedroom.

4. Gemini (May 21 - June 20)

Geminis love experimenting and keeping things interesting, ensuring their partners never get bored. Libra and Aquarius are their strongest zodiac matches, followed by Leo, Aries, and Sagittarius.

Pisces are known for their romantic and empathetic nature, which makes them attentive and intuitive lovers.

5. Pisces (February 19 – March 20)

They have a deep emotional connection with their partners, creating a sense of trust and intimacy in the bedroom. Pisces are imaginative and creative, always seeking to please their partners uniquely. Their ideal match partners include Scorpio, Taurus, and Capricorn.

These zodiac signs are known for their unique skills and passion for intimacy and romance.

Whether you're a Libra, Scorpio, Leo, Gemini, or Pisces, you can rest assured that you have what it takes to satisfy your partner in the bedroom. And if you are with one of these signs as your match partner, you're in for a fulfilling experience. So, embrace your zodiac sign's qualities and enjoy the magic between you and your partner behind closed doors. Remember, the stars may align in your favor regarding heart matters.

scraped_articles.title: 7 Great Yakuza Movies You Must Watch
scraped_articles.meta_description: From the classic
scraped_articles.content:
7 Great Yakuza Movies You Must Watch

7 Great Yakuza Movies You Must Watch

The yakuza have long been a fascinating subject in both real life and in film. Their code of honor, loyalty, and the dark underworld they operate in have inspired some of the best movies in cinematic history. From intense action to gripping dramas, yakuza movies have something for everyone.

In this article, we will explore some of the best yakuza movies ever made. From classics that have stood the test of time to modern masterpieces, these films showcase the best that the genre has to offer.

1. Tokyo Drifter (1966)

Tokyo Drifter is a 1966 Japanese movie directed by Seijun Suzuki. It's a stylish action film about a yakuza hitman trying to leave his life of crime behind. However, he must run away to save his life from his old enemies.

The movie is known for its vibrant colors, cool jazz soundtrack, and stylish action sequences. It's a classic of Japanese cinema.

2. Branded to Kill (1967)

Branded to Kill

Branded to Kill is a 1967 Japanese action film directed by Seijun Suzuki. The movie follows the story of a hitman who is ranked as the third-best in his profession. However, his life takes a turn when he falls in love with a mysterious woman and becomes the target of other assassins. Full of intense actions and enigmatic characters, this movie has become a cult classic among enthusiasts.

3. Fireworks (1997)

Directed by Takeshi Kitano, "Fireworks" follows Detective Nishi as he grapples with personal tragedies, including the death of his daughter and his wife's terminal illness.

Seeking solace, he turns to the yakuza for financial help, embarking on a reckless journey to create meaningful moments amid life's challenges. The film combines stark visuals with Kitano's signature reflective style.

4. Outrage (2010)

"Outrage" is a Japanese crime thriller film released in 2010. The movie follows a power struggle within the yakuza, the Japanese organized crime syndicate. The plot revolves around betrayal and a fight for control, leading to escalating violence and deception.

Directed by Takeshi Kitano, the film features intense and gripping scenes that keep viewers on the edge of their seats.

5. Sonatine (1993)

"Sonatine" is a Japanese crime film released in 1993. The movie follows a yakuza gangster who takes his crew to a seaside town to lay low, but they end up getting involved in a gang war.

The film is known for its slow pace, intense violence, and artistic cinematography. "Sonatine" received critical acclaim for its unique storytelling and captivating visuals.

6. The Yakuza (1974)

The Yakuza is a 1974 crime film directed by Sydney Pollack. The movie follows a retired detective who teams up with a Japanese friend to rescue his kidnapped daughter from a powerful Yakuza clan.

With a mix of action, drama, and suspense, The Yakuza is a compelling and intense watch.

"Graveyard of Honor" is a Japanese movie released in 1975. It follows the life of a yakuza gangster, Rikio Ishikawa, and his ruthless and violent rise to power within the criminal underworld. The film depicts Ishikawa's downfall and his eventual demise. It is a gritty and intense portrayal of crime and violence.

7. Graveyard of Honor (1975)

scraped_articles.meta_description: Let the

scraped_articles.content:
50 Art of War Quotes about Life That Will Teach Strategy and Inspire You

50 Art of War Quotes about Life That Will Teach Strategy and Inspire You

Sun Tzu's "The Art of War" insights are lasting words in the landscape of wisdom and strategy. Beyond its reputation as a classic military study, the knowledge encapsulated in its terms transcends the battlefield. These "Art of War quotes" reflect on life, leadership, and navigating the complexities of life.

Join us through the deep teachings of "The Art of War quote." It is where strategy meets the canvas of everyday life. These Art of War quotes about life are tactical notes and the mark of a masterpiece that imparts lessons. These Art of War quotes inspire us on the complex canvas of existence.

Here are some "Art of War quotes," compiled from numerous sources, Thursday (16/11/2023).

1. “He will win who knows when to fight and when not to fight.” ~ Sun Tzu

2. “In the midst of chaos, there is also opportunity.” ~ Sun Tzu

3. “In the midst of chaos, there is also opportunity.” ~ Sun Tzu

4. “Even the finest sword plunged into salt water will eventually rust.” ~ Sun Tzu

5. “Wheels of justice grind slow but grind fine.” ~ Sun Tzu

6. “Appear weak when you are strong, and strong when you are weak.” ~ Sun Tzu

7. “Sweat more during peace: bleed less during war.” ~ Sun Tzu

8. “Treat your men as you would your own beloved sons. And they will follow you into the deepest valley.” ~ Sun Tzu

Art of War Quotes

9. “Victorious warriors win first and then go to war, while defeated warriors go to war first and then seek to win.” ~ Sun Tzu

10. “Quickness is the essence of the war.” ~ Sun Tzu

11. “Never venture, never win!” ~ Sun Tzu

12. “The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting.” ~ Sun Tzu

13. “When you surround an army, leave an outlet free. Do not press a desperate foe too hard.” ~ Sun Tzu

14. “If the mind is willing, the flesh could go on and on without many things.” ~ Sun Tzu

Art of War Quotes

15. “Victory comes from finding opportunities in problems.” ~ Sun Tzu

16. “Quickness is the essence of the war.” – Sun Tzu

17. “If the mind is willing, the flesh could go on and on without many things.” – Sun Tzu

18. “Rewards for good service should not be deferred a single day.” – Sun Tzu

19. “Invincibility lies in the defense; the possibility of victory in the attack.” – Sun Tzu

20. “A leader leads by example, not by force.” – Sun Tzu

21. “Even the finest sword plunged into salt water will eventually rust.” – Sun Tzu

22. "The art of war is of vital importance to the State. It is a matter of life and death, a road either to safety or to ruin." – Sun Tzu

23. “Build your opponent a golden bridge to retreat across.” ~ Sun Tzu

24. “Who wishes to fight must first count the cost.” ~ Sun Tzu

25. “One may know how to conquer without being able to do it.” ~ Sun Tzu

Art of War Quotes

26. “One mark of a great soldier is that he fight on his own terms or fights not at all.” ~ Sun Tzu

27. “Strategy without tactics is the slowest route to victory. Tactics without strategy is the noise before defeat.” ~ Sun Tzu

28. “There is no instance of a nation benefiting from prolonged warfare.” ~ Sun Tzu

29. “Appear weak when you are strong, and strong when you are weak.” – Sun Tzu

30. “You have to believe in yourself.” ~ Sun Tzu

31. “He who is prudent and lies in wait for an enemy who is not, will be victorious.” ~ Sun Tzu

32. “What the ancients called a clever fighter is one who not only wins, but excels in winning with ease.” ~ Sun Tzu

33. “Do not press an enemy at bay.” ~ Sun Tzu

34. “A wise general makes a point of foraging of the enemy.” ~ Sun Tzu

35. “The wise warrior avoids the battle.” – Sun Tzu

36. “There is no instance of a nation benefitting from prolonged warfare.” – Sun Tzu

37. “Supreme excellence consists of breaking the enemy’s resistance without fighting.” – Sun Tzu

Art of War Quotes

38. “So in war, the way is to avoid what is strong, and strike at what is weak.” – Sun Tzu

39. “It is easy to love your friend, but sometimes the hardest lesson to learn is to love your enemy.” – Sun Tzu

40. “Move swift as the Wind and closely-formed as the Wood. Attack like the Fire and be still as the Mountain.” – Sun Tzu

41. “To know your Enemy, you must become your Enemy.” – Sun Tzu

42. “If he sends reinforcements everywhere, he will everywhere be weak.” – Sun Tzu

43. “When you surround an army, leave an outlet free. Do not press a desperate foe too hard.” – Sun Tzu

44. “When the enemy is relaxed, make them toil. When full, starve them. When settled, make them move.” – Sun Tzu

45. "What the ancients called a clever fighter is one who not only wins, but excels in winning with ease." – Sun Tzu

46. “There is no instance of a nation benefitting from prolonged warfare.”

47. “For them to perceive the advantage of defeating the enemy, they must also have their rewards.” ~ Sun Tzu

48. “Attack is the secret of defense; defense is the planning of an attack.” ~ Sun Tzu

49. “Great results, can be achieved with small forces.” ~ Sun Tzu

50. “Let your plans be dark and impenetrable as night, and when you move, fall like a thunderbolt.” – Sun Tzu

Art of War Quotes

As we finish exploring "The Art of War quotes," let these old words of wisdom resonate on our life path. Beyond the realms of war and strategy, they guide us in navigating the nuanced landscape of our lives.

Whether confronting challenges or celebrating victories, Sun Tzu's teachings show us that life is a strategic ambition—an intricate dance of choices and actions.

May these quotes inspire, encouraging you to approach each day with the wisdom of a seasoned strategist and the resilience of a true warrior. Let the "Art of War quotes" become the art of living—a journey of strategy, strength, and endless growth.

scraped_articles.title: Shohei Ohtani: What Makes The Japanese Baseball Player so Special?
scraped_articles.meta_description: Shohei Ohtani is showing his dominance in the baseball world and his return to the mound further solidifies his status as a unique and talented two-way player.
scraped_articles.content:
Shohei Ohtani: What Makes The Japanese Baseball Player so Special?

Who doesn't know Shohei Ohtani?

This professional baseball player from Japan is phenomenal!

Playing as a designated hitter (DH) and pitcher for the Los Angeles Dodgers in Major League Baseball (MLB), Ohtani is known for his extraordinary abilities in both positions.

There are very few players as great as him, which is why he is often referred to as a unique "two-way" player.

What Makes Ohtani so Special?

Shohei Ohtani leads NL players in All-Star voting with almost 1.4M votes!

The top vote-getter in each league through June 26 earns an automatic All-Star bid. https://t.co/HDyi2uAFHY pic.twitter.com/mcfWuGxU1S

— MLB (@MLB) June 16, 2025

Ohtani is a rare breed because he is a great hitter and pitcher.

He has proven himself time and time again as one of the best baseball players in the world.

His return to the mound after an injury further solidifies his status as a unique and talented player.

In fact, he is one of the few pitchers who is also a leadoff hitter.

Before joining the MLB, Ohtani had already achieved many accomplishments in Nippon Professional Baseball (NPB) with the Hokkaido Nippon-Ham Fighters.

He even won the Japan Series and was named Pacific League MVP in 2016.

Ohtani's Amazing Achievements

Ohtani is indeed no ordinary player with the following achievements:

  1. Giant Contract: After the 2023 season, Ohtani signed a 10-year, $700 million contract with the Dodgers! Isn't that huge? It was the largest contract in professional sports history at the time.
  2. Back-to-back MVPs: He won the American League (AL) MVP award in 2022 and 2023. The first player to win the MVP unanimously twice! He even won the National League (NL) MVP in 2024.
  3. 50/50 Record: In 2024, Ohtani became the first player in MLB history to hit 50 home runs and 50 stolen bases in a single season.
  4. World Series Champion: He won the 2024 World Series in his first MLB postseason appearance.

scraped_articles.title: The Functions of Language According to Experts
scraped_articles.meta_description: Language is part of our daily life, but what is it and what are the functions of language?
scraped_articles.content:
The Functions of Language According to Experts

Language is something we use every day. We speak, write, listen, and read, but many people do not stop to think about how important language is. It helps us work, study, and connect with others. Still, not everyone understands the full meaning and functions of language.

The functions of language are more than just talking and listening. Language allows us to share ideas, express feelings, ask for things, and build relationships. However, the functions of language are often much deeper than they seem at first glance.

In this article, we will explore what language is according to various experts and functions of language according to Geoffrey Leech and Roman Jakobson. We gathered the information from various sources, Monday (28/4/2025).

What is Language?

Before we discuss the functions of language, let's understand what language is. Many experts have given different definitions of language over time.

According to Edward Sapir, language is "a purely human and non-instinctive method of communicating ideas, emotions, and desires by means of a system of voluntarily produced symbols." This means language is something only humans use, and we create it ourselves to share our thoughts.

Ferdinand de Saussure defined language as "a system of signs that express ideas." He explained that language works through signs that have two parts: the sound or written shape (signifier) and the meaning (signified).

Noam Chomsky, a famous language expert, says language is "the inherent capability of native speakers to understand and form grammatical sentences." He believes humans are born with the ability to learn language.

John Lyons describes languages as "the principal communication systems used by particular groups of human beings within the specific society of which they are members." This definition shows how language connects people in communities.

Henry Sweet, an English language scholar, stated that "Language is the expression of ideas by means of speech-sounds combined into words. Words are combined into sentences, this combination answering to that of ideas into thoughts." This definition focuses on how sounds form words and how words form sentences.

Bernard Bloch and George L. Trager defined language as "a system of arbitrary vocal symbols by means of which a social group cooperates." This highlights that language uses sounds that have no natural connection to their meanings, and that language helps people work together.

Aristotle, an ancient Greek philosopher, saw language as "the representation of the experience of the mind." He believed that when we speak, we are showing what is happening in our minds.

Bloomfield defined language as "the totality of the utterances that can be made in a speech community." This means language includes all the possible things that can be said by a group of people who speak to each other.

Derbyshire described language as "undoubtedly a kind of communication among human beings" that is "primarily vocal sounds, articulatory, systematic, symbolic, and arbitrary." This definition points out that language follows patterns and uses symbols that we agree on.

5 Functions of Language According to Geoffrey Leech

Geoffrey Leech, who lived from 1936 to 2014, identified five main functions of language that help us understand how we use it in daily life:

1. The Informational Function: This is used to provide facts and knowledge. When we describe things, explain processes, or give news, we use the informational function. Examples include textbooks, encyclopedias, news reports, and facts like "Water boils at 100 degrees Celsius."

2. The Expressive Function: This function helps us share our feelings, attitudes, and opinions. When you say "I love this song" or "That movie was boring," you are using the expressive function. It doesn't give factual information but shows your emotions or thoughts about something.

3. The Directive Function: This function aims to cause some action or reaction from the listener. Commands like "Close the door," requests such as "Could you help me?", and advice like "You should study more" all use the directive function. The success of this function depends on whether the listener follows the direction.

4. The Aesthetic Function: This function focuses on the beauty of language itself. Poetry, literature, songs, and creative writing use language for its beauty and artistic value. The aesthetic function treats words as art and focuses on how language sounds and feels rather than just what it means.

5. The Phatic Function: This function helps establish and maintain social relationships. Small talk like "How are you?" or "Nice weather today" may not share important information but keeps social connections open. Greetings, goodbyes, and casual conversation all serve the phatic function.

6 Functions of Language According to Roman Jakobson

Roman Jakobson, who lived from 1896 to 1982, developed another model with six functions of language:

1. The Referential Function: This function describes situations, objects, or mental states. It focuses on providing context. Weather reports, descriptions, and statements of fact use this function. For example, "It is raining in New York today."

2. The Poetic Function: This focuses on the message itself and how it is presented. It is used in poetry, slogans, and wordplay. The famous slogan "Just Do It" uses the poetic function through its rhythm and simplicity.

3. The Emotive Function: Similar to Leech's expressive function, this reveals the speaker's feelings. Interjections like "Wow!" or "Ouch!" and statements of emotion use this function.

4. The Conative Function: This function aims to make the receiver do something. It uses commands and requests like "Please sit down" or "Vote for me!" The focus is on creating a response from the listener.

5. The Phatic Function: Like Leech's phatic function, this is used to establish contact and maintain relationships. Greetings, farewells, and phrases like "Can you hear me?" serve this purpose.

6. The Metalingual Function: This unique function uses language to talk about language itself. When you ask "What does this word mean?" or discuss grammar rules, you are using the metalingual function.

Other Functions of Language

Beyond Leech and Jakobson, there are other functions of language that help us understand its importance:

1. The Social Function: This helps people form and maintain groups and communities. Language creates bonds between people who speak the same language or dialect and helps establish identity within social groups. When people use similar words or accents, they often feel connected to each other.

2. The Cognitive Function: This is how language shapes our thinking and helps us organize our thoughts. Some experts believe the language we speak influences how we see and understand the world around us. Different languages may lead people to notice different aspects of their environment.

3. The Cultural Function: Language preserves traditions, stories, and values across generations. Through language, we pass down knowledge and cultural practices that maintain our connection to the past. Stories, proverbs, and songs keep culture alive through language.

4. The Political Function: This concerns how language is used to gain or maintain power. Politicians carefully choose their words to persuade people, and groups in society may use language to include or exclude others. Language can be a tool for unity or division.

scraped_articles.title: 30 Long Distance Relationship Quotes to Strengthen Your Bond Across the Miles
scraped_articles.meta_description: These long distance relationship quotes can provide hope and strength for couples facing the distance between them.
scraped_articles.content:
30 Long Distance Relationship Quotes to Strengthen Your Bond Across the Miles

30 Long Distance Relationship Quotes to Strengthen Your Bond Across the Miles

Maintaining a strong connection with our loved ones is important when distance separates us. LDR presents unique challenges but offers opportunities for growth and deep intimacy. In this collection of 30 long-distance relationship quotes, we explore words of wisdom. They can provide hope and strength for couples facing the distance between them.

These long distance relationship quotes are perfect for couples separated by an ocean or only a few hours apart. They strengthen the bond between partners. These inspirational words also remind us that love knows no distance.
Join us as we explore long distance relationship quotes and share them with your loved ones. freepik

Deep Long Distance Relationship Quotes

  • "If my voice could reach back through the past I'd whisper in your ear, 'Oh darling I wish you were here.'" — Owl City

  • "The reason it hurts so much to separate is because our souls are connected." — Nicholas Sparks

  • "I close my eyes, thinking that there is nothing like an embrace after an absence, nothing like fitting my face into the curve of his shoulder and filling my lungs with the scent of him." — Jodi Picoult

  • "Distance is not for the fearful, it is for the bold. It's for those who are willing to spend a lot of time alone in exchange for a little time with the one they love. It's for those knowing a good thing when they see it, even if they don't see it nearly enough." — Meghan Daum
  • "Love knows no distance; it hath no continent; its eyes are for the stars." — Gilbert Parker

  • "Distance means so little when someone means so much." — Tom McNeal

  • "Ocean separates lands, not souls." — Munia Khan

  • "The pain of parting is nothing to the joy of meeting again." — Charles Dickens

  • “I think we dream so we don’t have to be apart for so long. If we’re in each other’s dreams, we can be together all the time.” ― A.A. Milne

  • “Absence diminishes small loves and increases great ones, as the wind blows out the candle and fans the bonfire.” ― François Duc de la Rochefoucauld, “Maxims”

Sweet Long Distance Relationship Quotes

  • "I exist in two places, here and where you are." — Margaret Atwood

  • "The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched. They must be felt with the heart." — Helen Keller

  • “When two souls are one, they hear each other, even in silence.” ― Matshona Dhliwayo

  • “She is the one in my heart and I’m zero without her when the world tries to divide her from me that’s where our love becomes infinite.” ― Nanruth Nanda

  • "No matter where I am, no matter where you are, I'll always carry you in my heart." - Unknown

  • "I don't cry because we've been separated by distance, and for a matter of years. Why? Because for as long as we share the same sky and breathe the same air, we're still together." - Donna Lynn Hope

  • "True love doesn't mean being inseparable; it means being separated and nothing changes." - Unknown

  • "Every minute feels like an hour, every hour feels like a day, every day feels like forever, but I will wait forever and a day for you." - Unknown

  • "If you listen to the wind very carefully, you'll be able to hear me whisper my love for you." - Andrew Davidson

  • "I may not always be there with you, but I will always be there for you." - Unknown

Long Distance Relationship Quotes

Funny Long Distance Relationship Quotes

  • “How is it that he’s always in my thoughts even when I am not thinking?” — Sanober Khan

  • “I always joke and laugh when people ask me what’s the key to my long marriage and lasting love. I always say ‘Stay gone!’ and there’s a lot of truth to that.” — Dolly Parton

  • "Being in a long distance relationship is like being in school all over again: You have to study hard to make it work." - Unknown

  • “I want to be with you. It’s as simple and as complicated as that.” — Charles Bukowski

  • "I’m jealous of people who get to see you every day. I bet they don’t even appreciate it!" - Unknown

  • "Distance is just a test to see how far love can travel." - Unknown

  • "Long distance relationships are basically just two people sending each other memes and waiting to be reunited." - Unknown


  • "Absence makes the heart grow fonder, but it sure makes the rest of you lonely." - Charles M. Schulz

  • "Distance sucks, but I’ll deal with it if it means getting to see you." - Unknown

  • "I wish we lived closer together... like in the same room." - Unknown

Long Distance Relationship Quotes

Author:

Rizki Amelia Putri (intern)

scraped_articles.content:
How to Make Coffee Without a Coffee Maker With 3 Easy Methods

How to Make Coffee Without a Coffee Maker With 3 Easy Methods

Have you ever found yourself craving a cup of coffee but realized you don't have a coffee maker? Learning how to make coffee without a coffee maker can be a lifesaver in such situations.

Whether your coffee maker is broken, you're camping, or you simply want to try something new, there are several easy methods to brew a delicious cup of coffee using items you probably already have at home.

There's something special about making coffee by hand. It allows you to appreciate the process and enjoy the aroma and flavor more fully. Plus, these methods can be just as effective as a traditional coffee maker and sometimes even better.

In this article, we will explore different ways how to make coffee without a coffee maker.

Each method has its unique steps and benefits, so you can find the one that suits you best. From the classic saucepan method to the popular pour-over technique, there's a method for everyone. We gathered these guides from various sources, Friday (14/6/2024). Learning these methods helps to open up a world of possibilities and can improve your coffee-making skills.

Making coffee with a saucepan is the very classic method to make this tasty beverage. You don't need to use any special tool to make it. Here's how to make a tasty cup of coffee with a saucepan:

A. How to Make Coffee With a Saucepan

Ingredients and Tools

  • Ground coffee: 2 tablespoons

  • Water: 1 cup (240 ml)

  • Tools:
- Saucepan
- Spoon
- Stove
- Fine mesh strainer or cheesecloth
- Mug

Instructions

1. Measure the water: Pour 1 cup (240 ml) of water into the saucepan.

2. Heat the water: Place the saucepan on the stove and heat the water over medium heat until it begins to simmer. Do not let it come to a full boil.

3. Add the coffee grounds: Once the water is simmering, add 2 tablespoons of ground coffee to the saucepan. Stir gently with a spoon to combine.

4. Simmer the mixture

Let the coffee and water mixture simmer for about 2-3 minutes. This allows the coffee grounds to release their flavor into the water.

5. Remove from heat: After 2-3 minutes, remove the saucepan from the heat. Let it sit for another 2-3 minutes to allow the coffee grounds to settle at the bottom of the pan.

6. Strain the coffee: Place a fine mesh strainer or cheesecloth over your mug and carefully pour the coffee through it. This will filter out the coffee grounds, giving you a smooth cup of coffee.

7. Serve and enjoy: Your coffee is ready to enjoy! Add milk, sugar, or any other preferred flavorings if desired.

French press is a wonderful tool for making simple but very tasty coffee. This method is very easy, even for beginners, making it so popular among many people. Here's how to make coffee with French press:

B. How to Make Coffee With French Press

Ingredients and Tools

  • Ground coffee: 2 tablespoons (for a small French press) or 4 tablespoons (for a larger French press)

  • Water: 1 cup (240 ml) or 2 cups (480 ml), depending on the size of your French press

  • Tools:
- French press
- Kettle or pot (for boiling water)
- Spoon
- Mug

Instructions

1. Boil the water: Heat the water in a kettle or pot until it reaches a rolling boil. You'll need 1 cup (240 ml) for a small French press or 2 cups (480 ml) for a larger French press.

2. Preheat the French press: Pour a small amount of the boiling water into the French press to preheat it. Swirl the water around and then discard it.

3. Add coffee grounds: Place 2 tablespoons of ground coffee (for a small French press) or 4 tablespoons (for a larger French press) into the bottom of the French press.

4. Add hot water: Pour the boiling water over the coffee grounds in the French press. Make sure all the grounds are saturated with water. Stir gently with a spoon to combine.

5. Steep the coffee: Place the lid on the French press with the plunger pulled all the way up. Let the coffee steep for about 4 minutes. This allows the coffee to fully extract and develop its flavor.

6. Press the plunger: After 4 minutes, slowly and evenly press the plunger down to separate the coffee grounds from the liquid.

7. Serve and enjoy: Pour the brewed coffee into your mug. Add milk, sugar, or any other preferred flavorings if desired.

The pour-over method is another very popular way to make coffee. This method is known for producing a clean, flavorful cup of coffee that highlights the beans' natural flavors. Here's how to do it:

C. How to Make Coffee With Pour-Over Method

Ingredients and Tools

  • Ground coffee: 2 tablespoons

  • Water: 1 cup (240 ml)

  • Tools:
- Pour-over dripper
- Paper filter
- Kettle (preferably with a gooseneck spout)
- Mug

Instructions

1. Boil the water: Heat the water in a kettle until it reaches a rolling boil. You'll need 1 cup (240 ml) for one serving of coffee.

2. Prepare the dripper: Place the paper filter in the pour-over dripper. Position the dripper on top of your mug.

3. Rinse the filter: Pour a small amount of hot water through the paper filter to rinse it. This removes any papery taste and preheats the dripper and mug. Discard the rinse water.

4. Add coffee grounds:

Place 2 tablespoons of ground coffee into the rinsed filter. Shake the dripper gently to level the coffee grounds.

5. Start pouring: Slowly pour a small amount of hot water over the coffee grounds, just enough to wet them evenly. Allow the coffee to bloom for about 30 seconds. This releases trapped gases and enhances the flavor.

6. Continue pouring: After the bloom, slowly pour the remaining hot water over the coffee grounds in a circular motion. Pour steadily and ensure all the grounds are evenly saturated. This process should take about 2-3 minutes.

7. Serve and enjoy: Once the water has finished dripping through the coffee grounds, remove the dripper and discard the filter and grounds. Your coffee is ready to enjoy! Add milk, sugar, or any other preferred flavorings if desired.

scraped_articles.title: 55 Blessing Quotes To Bring Positivity To Your Life
scraped_articles.meta_description: Feeling blessed is something simple, but often being overlooked. These blessing quotes remind you to always be grateful for what you've already had.
scraped_articles.content:
55 Blessing Quotes To Bring Positivity To Your Life

In today's busy world, we often focus on trying to outdo others and be the best. In this race, we forget to appreciate the simple joy of feeling blessed. This article invites you to rediscover that joy through the wisdom of powerful blessing quotes.

55 Blessing Quotes To Bring Positivity To Your Life

Feeling blessed may seem small, but it's a big deal in our lives. When we're always comparing ourselves to others, we might miss the good things around us. It can leave us feeling unhappy, constantly trying to catch up with people ahead of us, and forgetting what we already have. This can lead to stress and disappointment, especially when we don't reach our goals.

Blessing quotes can help us remember the importance of being grateful for the good things in our lives. They encourage us to shift our focus from always wanting more to appreciating what we have right now.

In this article, we have selected some of the most powerful and meaningful blessing quotes from various sources, Friday (10/11/2023).

These quotes will gently remind you of the true meaning of feeling blessed and why it's important. Join us on this journey as we explore the beauty of blessing quotes and how they can make your daily life better.

© 2023 trstdly.com

A. Short Blessing Quotes

1. "Pray for guidance and give thanks for your blessings everyday." - John Wooden

2. "You never know where a blessing can come from." - Teena Marie

3. "We are all born to be a blessing." - Rachel Naomi Remen

4. "Bless more; blame less." - Marianne Williamson

5. "What seems to us as bitter trials are often blessings in disguise" - Oscar Wilde

6. "The love of a family is life's greatest blessing" - Eva Burrows

7. "I'm extremely happy in my life. I consider myself to be very blessed." - Joan Collins

8. "A contented mind is the greatest blessing a man can enjoy in this world." - Joseph Addison

9. "Blessed is the influence of one true, loving human soul on another." - George Eliot

10. "Blessed are the hearts that can bend; they shall never be broken." - Albert Camus

11. "You're blessed if you have the strength to work." - Mahalia Jackson

12. "Advice is one of those things it is far more blessed to give than to receive." - Carolyn Wells

13. "Humor is man's greatest blessing." - Mark Twain

14. "Every day is a blessing, and every moment is an opportunity to embrace life with gratitude." - Unknown

15. "You will be blessed the moment you realize you already are." - Bryant McGill

B. Meaningful Blessing Quotes

1. "When one is thankful for the blessings in their life, they are choosing to attract more positivity and abundance." - Michael Austin Jacobs

2. "I am blessed to have so many great things in my life – family, friends, and God. All will be in my thoughts daily." - Lil' Kim

3. "Learn to walk in the will of God we will learn to see the blessings God has given us and be more grateful." - Heather Bixler

4. "Blessed is he who has learned to admire but not envy, to follow but not imitate, to praise but not flatter, and to lead but not manipulate." - William Arthur Ward

5. "If I choose to bless another person, I will always end up feeling more blessed." - Marianne Williamson

6. "A man without ambition is dead. A man with ambition but no love is dead. A man with ambition and love for his blessings here on earth is ever so alive." - Pearl Bailey

7. "Gratitude lifts our eyes off the things we lack so we might see the blessings we possess." - Max Lucado

8. "There are no mistakes, no coincidences; all events are blessings given to us to learn from." - Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

9. "Blessed is he who has learned to admire but not envy, to follow but not imitate, to praise but not flatter, and to lead but not manipulate."

- William Arthur Ward

10. "Life holds so many simple blessings, each day bringing its own individual wonder." - John McLeod

11. "The real issue in life is not how many blessings we have, but what we do with our blessings. Some people have many blessings and hoard them. Some have few and give everything away." - Fred Rogers

12. "A blessed thing it is for any man or woman to have a friend, one human soul whom we can trust utterly, who knows the best and worst of us, and who loves us in spite of all our faults." - Charles Kingsley

13. "Reflect upon your present blessings of which every man has many - not on your past misfortunes, of which all men have some."

- Charles Dickens

14. "Each day offers us the gift of being a special occasion if we can simply learn that as well as giving, it is blessed to receive with grace and a grateful heart." - Sarah Ban Breathnach

15. "Blessed are those who give without remembering. And blessed are those who take without forgetting." - Bernard Meltzer

16. "God changes his appearance every second. Blessed is the man who can recognize him in all his disguises." - Nikos Kazantzakis

© 2023 trstdly.com

17. "Being blessed is a condition of the heart and a frame of mind." - Errin Rhorie

18. "If you're lucky to have three close people in your life, you're blessed." - Tiger Woods

19. "Love and kindness are never wasted. They always make a difference. They bless the one who receives them, and they bless you, the giver." - Barbara De Angelis

20. "The unthankful heart discovers no mercies; but the thankful heart will find, in every hour, some heavenly blessings." - Henry Ward Beecher

C. Inspirational Blessing Quotes

1. "The secret of happiness is to count your blessings while others are adding up their troubles." - William Penn

2. "Count your blessings. A grateful heart attracts more joy, love and prosperity." - Cheryl Richardson

3. "Focus on your strengths, not your weaknesses. Focus on your character, not your reputation. Focus on your blessings, not your misfortunes." - Roy T. Bennett

4. "More smiling, less worrying. More compassion, less judgment. More blessed, less stressed. More love, less hate." - Roy T. Bennett

5. "The more we express our gratitude to God for our blessings, the more he will bring to our mind other blessings. The more we are aware of to be grateful for, the happier we become." - Ezra Taft Benson

6. "Life is not always easy to live, but the opportunity to do so is a blessing beyond comprehension. In the process of living, we will face struggles, many of which will cause us to suffer and to experience pain." - L. Lionel Kendrick

7. "Cherish what you have because not all people are blessed with the things that you are enjoying." - Faith Starr

8. "To me, life is a gift, and it's a blessing to just be alive. And each person should learn what a gift it is to be alive no matter how tough things get."

- Tony Bennett

9. "So, before you even get out of bed, give silent thanks for another day on this earth." - Sumit Gautam

10. "Blessing must arise from within your own mind. It is not something that comes from outside." - Dalai Lama

11. "Every day send some blessings to the world. Let there be flow of love" - Amit Ray

12. "Learn to be thankful for what you already have, while you pursue all that you want." - Jim Rohn

13. "Acknowledging the good that you already have in your life is the foundation for all abundance." - Eckart Tolle

14. "I believe the ability to think is blessed. If you can think about a situation, you can deal with it. The big struggle is to keep your head clear enough to think." - Richard Pryor

15. "Better to lose count while naming your blessings than to lose your blessings to counting your troubles." - Maltbie D. Babcock

16. "If we could spend time counting our blessings, one by one, rather than obsessing on our obstacles, we would realize how blessed we are, truly." - Joan Ambu

17. "A blessing is a circle of light drawn around a person to protect, heal and strengthen." - John O'Donohue

18. "The problem that we have with a victim mentality is that we forget to see the blessings of the day. Because of this, our spirit is poisoned instead of nourished." - Steve Maraboli

19. "Blessed are they who see beautiful things in humble places where other people see nothing." - Camille Pissarro

20. "Sometimes we must look outside our own backyards to realize how big the world is and how blessed we are." - Eugene Nathaniel Butler

scraped_articles.title: Top 5 Underrated Songs by Green Day!
scraped_articles.meta_description: ‘Greenday’, which is famous for its songs such as American Idiot or Wake Me Up When September Ends, has several underrated titles that you must listen to!
scraped_articles.content:
Top 5 Underrated Songs by Green Day!

1. “J.A.R. (Jason Andrew Relva)” – International Superhits! (2001)

Originally featured on the Angus movie soundtrack and later included in International Superhits!, “J.A.R.” is a tribute to bassist Mike Dirnt’s childhood friend who passed away in a car accident.

It's a powerful punk anthem that blends emotional lyrics with Green Day’s signature energetic sound.

Despite charting briefly, the song has often been overshadowed by bigger hits like “Basket Case” or “When I Come Around.”

Yet, its introspective theme, strong hooks, and tight instrumentation make it one of their most heartfelt and overlooked tracks.

2. “Stuart and the Ave.” – Insomniac (1995)

Buried in the fast and furious Insomniac album, “Stuart and the Ave.” captures the frustration and confusion of personal disillusionment and relationships.

The raw energy, angsty vocals, and a more abrasive sound highlight a darker period for the band post-Dookie.

With its gritty guitar riffs and emotionally charged delivery, the song is a perfect representation of Green Day’s ability to turn angst into art.

Yet, it often goes unnoticed among fans and critics alike.

3. “Whatsername” – American Idiot (2004)

As the final track of the iconic American Idiot rock opera, “Whatsername” delivers a bittersweet reflection on love, memory, and moving on.

Its quiet buildup to an emotional crescendo makes it a beautifully crafted closer to the story of the album’s protagonist, Jesus of Suburbia.

Despite its narrative importance and haunting melody, it’s often overlooked in favor of more explosive singles like “Holiday” or “Boulevard of Broken Dreams.”

“Whatsername” subtly lingers in listeners’ minds long after the album ends.

4. “Macy’s Day Parade” – Warning (2000)

A mellow acoustic ballad in contrast to Green Day’s typical punk fury, “Macy’s Day Parade” is a somber commentary on materialism and the search for meaning.

Closing out the Warning album, it highlights a more mature and contemplative side of the band.

Billie Joe Armstrong’s reflective lyrics and subdued vocals lend emotional weight, making it a quiet gem.

It didn’t receive the attention it deserved due to the album’s lower commercial performance, but the song showcases Green Day’s lyrical growth and sonic experimentation.

5. “Peacemaker” – 21st Century Breakdown (2009)

“Peacemaker” is one of the most experimental and theatrical tracks on 21st Century Breakdown, fusing Latin rhythms with punk-rock flair.

Its sharp lyrics and playful yet biting tone critique violence and hypocrisy, wrapped in a melody that sounds almost like a rebellious cabaret.

The song’s creativity and uniqueness within Green Day’s catalog are often overlooked due to the overshadowing success of tracks like “21 Guns.”

Yet, “Peacemaker” stands out as a testament to Green Day’s willingness to evolve and take risks.

Top 6 Scariest Horror Games On Android

Top 6 Scariest Horror Games On Android

Are you a fan of horror games? Do you enjoy the adrenaline rush of being scared out of your wits while playing on your Android device? If so, then you're in for a treat!

We've compiled a list of the scariest horror games to play on Android that will have you on the edge of your seat. Whether you're a seasoned gamer or just beginning your journey into the world of horror games, these games are sure to give you a thrill.

1. Dead By Daylight Mobile

Dead By Daylight is a popular multiplayer horror game where you can play as a survivor trying to escape a relentless killer or as the killer hunting down the survivors.

The mobile version brings the same intense gameplay and heart-pounding moments to your Android device.

With its eerie atmosphere and unpredictable gameplay, Dead By Daylight Mobile is a must-play for horror fans.

2. Deadly Nightmare

Get ready for an exciting and engaging horror experience with Deadly Nightmare! Play as a boy living in a big manor, tasked with breaking family curses before it's too late.

Explore eerie locations, gather materials, and craft spells to protect yourself from supernatural threats. Can you unravel the mysteries and survive the night?

3. Eyes Horror & Coop Multiplayer

Eyes Horror is a chilling horror game that challenges you to explore a haunted mansion while avoiding the ghostly presence that haunts its halls. With its immersive gameplay and terrifying atmosphere, Eyes Horror will have you jumping at every creak and whisper.

The Coop Multiplayer mode allows you to team up with friends to uncover the secrets of the mansion together and escape from the nightmarish situation.

4. Five Nights at Freddy's

Five Nights at Freddy's is a classic horror game that has become a household name in the world of gaming. In this game, you play as a security guard working the night shift at a haunted pizzeria filled with animatronic monsters.

Your job is to survive the night by monitoring the security cameras and keeping the animatronics at bay. With its intense gameplay and jump scares, Five Nights at Freddy's is a must-play for horror enthusiasts.

5. The Baby In Yellow

The Baby In Yellow is a psychological horror game that puts you in the shoes of a babysitter watching over a mysterious baby in a dark and foreboding house.

As you care for the baby, strange events begin to unfold, leading to a terrifying discovery. With its unsettling atmosphere and eerie storyline, The Baby In Yellow will keep you on edge as you uncover the truth behind the baby's origins.

6. Endless Nightmare 2: Hospital

Endless Nightmare 2: Hospital is a horror game set in an abandoned hospital where unspeakable horrors await those who dare to enter.

As you explore the dark corridors and decrepit rooms of the hospital, you must unravel the mysteries that lie within while avoiding the malevolent entities that roam the halls.

With its frightening atmosphere and challenging gameplay, Endless Nightmare 2: Hospital is a truly spine-tingling experience for horror fans.

scraped_articles.title: What Are Tariffs? Definitions, Types, and Their Impacts to the Economy
scraped_articles.meta_description: President Donald Trump just imposed tariffs on Canada, Mexico, and China, but what are tariffs? How do they work? How do tariffs impact the economy?
scraped_articles.meta_keywords: what are tariffs,how do tariffs work,positive impacts of tariffs,negative impacts of tariffs
scraped_articles.content:
What Are Tariffs? Definitions, Types, and Their Impacts to the Economy

After President Donald Trump announced new tariffs on imports from Mexico, Canada, and China on February 1, 2025, many people may wonder: what are tariffs? These tariffs include a 25% tax on goods from Mexico and Canada and a 10% tax on Chinese imports. The goal of these tariffs is to protect American jobs and industries. However, many people are concerned about how these tariffs will affect prices for everyday products.

So, what are tariffs? Tariffs are taxes that countries impose on imported goods. They make foreign products more expensive, encouraging people to buy local products instead. Understanding what tariffs are is important because they can affect the economy, jobs, and the prices of many items we buy daily.

In this article, we will explain what tariffs are, how they work, and their positive and negative effects on the economy and consumers. We gathered the information from various sources, Sunday (1/2/2025). This will help you understand why tariffs matter in today’s world.

What Are Tariffs?

A tariff is a tax that a government places on goods imported from other countries. When a country imposes a tariff, it makes foreign products more expensive. This encourages consumers to buy products made in their own country instead of imported ones.

There are four main types of tariffs:

1. Ad Valorem Tariffs: These are based on a percentage of the value of the imported goods. For example, if you import a product worth $100 and there is a 10% tariff, you will pay $10 in tax.

2. Specific Tariffs: These are fixed amounts charged per unit of goods. For example, if there is a $1 tariff on each imported avocado, you will pay $1 for every avocado you bring into the country.

3. Tariff-Rate Quotas: These allow a certain amount of goods to be imported at a lower tariff rate. Once that amount is exceeded, a higher tariff applies.

4. Compound Tariffs: These combine both ad valorem and specific tariffs. For example, an imported product may have a fixed charge plus a percentage of its value as the tariff.

Tariffs can vary depending on the type of product and the country it comes from. They are collected by customs officials when goods enter the country.

How Do Tariffs Work?

Tariffs work by increasing the cost of imported goods. When tariffs are imposed, companies that import these goods must pay the tax to the government. This cost is often passed on to consumers in the form of higher prices.

For example, if a company imports shoes from another country and there is a 20% tariff on those shoes, the company pays more for them. To cover this cost, the company may raise the price of the shoes in stores. As a result, consumers end up paying more for these imported shoes.

Tariffs can also affect domestic industries. When foreign products become more expensive due to tariffs, consumers may choose to buy locally made products instead. This can help local businesses grow and create jobs.

However, tariffs do not always lead to positive outcomes for everyone. While some local industries may benefit from reduced competition from foreign products, other industries that rely on imported materials may suffer from increased costs.

Positive Effects of Tariffs

There are several positive effects of tariffs:

1. Protecting Local Jobs: Tariffs can help protect jobs in domestic industries by making it harder for foreign companies to sell their products at lower prices. This means that local workers may keep their jobs because consumers will choose domestic products over more expensive imports.

2. Encouraging Local Production: When foreign products become more expensive due to tariffs, consumers may choose to buy locally made items instead. This can boost local businesses and encourage them to produce more goods, leading to greater investment in domestic manufacturing capabilities.

3. Increasing Government Revenue: Tariffs generate income for the government through taxes collected on imports. The money collected from tariffs can be used for public services like education and healthcare, which benefits society as a whole by funding important programs.

4. Reducing Trade Deficits: By making imports more expensive, tariffs can help reduce trade deficits (when a country imports more than it exports). This can strengthen the economy over time by encouraging exports and improving trade balances with other countries.

5. Promoting Fair Trade Practices: Tariffs can be used as a tool against unfair trade practices by other countries. If a country subsidizes its exports or sells them at very low prices (dumping), placing tariffs can level the playing field for domestic producers who compete fairly without such advantages.

Negative Effects of Tariffs

While there are benefits to tariffs, there are also negative effects:

1. Higher Prices for Consumers: The most immediate effect of tariffs is that they increase prices for consumers across various sectors. Imported goods become more expensive due to added taxes, which means people have to pay more for everyday items like clothing or electronics than they would without those tariffs.

2. Retaliation from Other Countries: Countries affected by tariffs may respond with their own tariffs on U.S. goods as retaliation. This can lead to trade wars that hurt both economies and result in even higher prices for consumers who rely on international trade for affordable products.

3. Impact on Domestic Industries: Not all domestic industries benefit from tariffs; some may suffer due to increased costs for raw materials that are imported from abroad. Industries that rely heavily on these materials may see reduced profits or even job losses as their operational costs rise due to higher input prices.

4. Economic Inefficiency: Economists argue that tariffs can lead to inefficiencies in the economy by protecting less competitive industries at the expense of consumers who pay higher prices for goods that could be cheaper if produced abroad without such taxes applied.

5. Job Losses in Some Sectors: While some jobs may be protected by tariffs in certain industries, others may be lost in sectors that rely heavily on imports or exports affected by retaliatory measures from other countries imposing similar taxes on U.S.-made goods.

scraped_articles.title: Top 6 Thrilling Action Movies On Netflix That Will Give You Adrenaline Rush
scraped_articles.meta_description: Here are the best action movies on Netflix that will give you adrenaline rush.

scraped_articles.content:
Top 6 Thrilling Action Movies On Netflix That Will Give You Adrenaline Rush

Top 6 Thrilling Action Movies On Netflix That Will Give You Adrenaline Rush

Looking for some adrenaline-pumping entertainment? Look no further than Netflix!

With a wide range of action movies to choose from, you can satisfy your craving for high-octane thrills without leaving the comfort of your couch.

So grab some popcorn, dim the lights, and let's find out the best action movies on Netflix that will make your heart pumping so hard.

1. Extraction

Featuring Chris Hemsworth, "Extraction" is a fast-paced action movie about a hardened mercenary hired to save a kidnapped boy in the chaotic world of Bangladesh.

Packed with intense fights, thrilling pursuits, and impressive stunts, this film will keep you engaged from the beginning to the end.

2. The Old Guard

Starring Charlize Theron, "The Old Guard" is about a group of immortal mercenaries who must fight to protect their identities and their abilities.

Packed with intense combat sequences and a thrilling plot, this film combines action, adventure, and supernatural elements to create an adrenaline-pumping experience.

3. The Dark Knight

"The Dark Night" is considered one of the best superhero movies of all time. It features Christian Bale as Batman and Heath Ledger as the iconic villain, Joker.

The movie is known for its captivating story, exciting action scenes, and outstanding performances.

Heath Ledger's performance as the mad Joker is superb and will send chills down your spine. If you enjoy action films, this one is highly recommended.

4. John Wick

Starring Keanu Reeves, "John Wick" follows a retired hitman seeking revenge against the gangsters who killed his dog and stole his car.

It's known for its stylish action choreography and impressive stunt work. This film has become a modern-day action classic and spawned two equally thrilling sequels.

5. Extraction 2

As a sequel to the first film, "Extraction 2" continues the story of Tyler Rake, played by Chris Hemsworth. This time, he embarks on another dangerous mission to save an imprisoned family of a ruthless gangster.

Expect more heart-pounding action, breathtaking stunts, and intense fight scenes that will surely keep you on the edge of your seat.

6. The Raid: Redemption

A police team finds themselves trapped in an old apartment building during their mission to capture a drug lord. They are forced to fight their way out using martial arts and sheer determination.

Despite its straightforward plot, the film is packed with thrilling action scenes. The impressive choreography and camera work make it one of the best modern action and martial arts movies.

scraped_articles.title: Aaron Rodgers' Wife: Why is The NFL Star Keeping His Marriage a Secret?
scraped_articles.meta_description: Rodgers shared that he has been married for
scraped_articles.content:
Aaron Rodgers' Wife: Why is The NFL Star Keeping His Marriage a Secret?

 NFL star Aaron Rodgers has confirmed that he got married during the 2025 offseason, but details about his wife remain largely under wraps.

The 41-year-old quarterback, who recently signed with the Pittsburgh Steelers, made the announcement during his first press conference with the team on June 10, 2025, after reporters noticed a wedding band on his finger. 

"Yeah, it's a wedding ring," said Rodgers.

Rodgers shared that he has been married for "a couple of months," but declined to reveal his wife's name or any specifics about the ceremony, emphasizing his desire to keep his personal life.

The confirmation ended weeks of speculation after Rodgers was spotted wearing a ring at public events, including the Kentucky Derby and his Steelers signing photo. 

Aaron Rodgers confirms that he did indeed show up to camp with a wedding ring on 💍

Congratulations to Rodgers and his new spouse 👏

(via @steelers) pic.twitter.com/pVayQygpBo

— Bleacher Report (@BleacherReport) June 10, 2025

Who is Aaron Rodgers' Wife?

While Rodgers has not officially named his wife, there are strong indications that she is a woman named Brittani.

Rodgers first mentioned a girlfriend named Brittani during a December 2024 appearance on "The Pat McAfee Show," and spoke fondly of her again in April 2025, describing himself as being in a "serious relationship".

Brittani is said to value her privacy, has no public social media presence, and prefers to stay out of the spotlight.

Rodgers has not confirmed if Brittani is indeed the woman he married, but she is the only partner he has referenced in recent months. 

Rodgers’ previous relationships have often been in the public eye, including high-profile romances with actress Olivia Munn, NASCAR driver Danica Patrick, and actress Shailene Woodley, to whom he was briefly engaged.

Since joining the Jets in 2023, Rodgers has adopted a more private lifestyle, which appears to extend to his marriage. 

With Rodgers preparing for his first season as the Steelers’ quarterback, fans are eager to see if his wife will make public appearances at games.

For now, Rodgers seems content to keep his marriage out of the media spotlight, focusing on both his personal happiness and his football career.

scraped_articles.title: 101 Mahjong Game: How to Play and Tips for Beginners
scraped_articles.meta_description: Mahjong game is a classic Chinese game that is loved by many people around the world. This is a guide how to play mahjong game for beginners.
scraped_articles.meta_keywords: Mahjong Game,How to Play Mahjong,Tips to Play Mahjong
scraped_articles.content:
101 Mahjong Game: How to Play and Tips for Beginners

101 Mahjong Game: How to Play and Tips for Beginners

Mahjong is a traditional Chinese game that has been enjoyed for centuries. The mahjong game is played with small tiles, each marked with different symbols and characters. This game is not only popular in China but also around the world, where many people gather to play and enjoy its unique challenges.

In the mahjong game, players use skill, strategy, and a bit of luck to form winning tile combinations. The game is often played with four players, though variations exist that can accommodate three players as well. Each session of mahjong can be different, providing endless entertainment and opportunities for players to improve their skills.

Learning to play mahjong can be a fun and rewarding experience. It combines elements of memory, calculation, and strategy, making it an engaging pastime for people of all ages. The game can be enjoyed casually with friends and family or competitively in tournaments.

If you are interested in learning how to play mahjong game, you come to the right place. In this article, we will talk about how to play mahjong for beginners. From learning about the tiles and tips and tricks for new players, we will cover anything you need to know to master this exciting game. We made this guide on Tuesday (18/6/2024).

A. Understanding the Tiles

In a mahjong game, the tiles are essential components that players use to form winning combinations. There are three main types of tiles: Suit tiles, Honor tiles, and Bonus tiles. Each type has its own unique symbols and purposes in the game.

1. Suit Tiles: 

Suit tiles are divided into three categories: Bamboo, Characters, and Dots. Each category has tiles numbered from one to nine. Bamboo tiles feature bamboo sticks, Character tiles have Chinese characters, and Dot tiles display circles. Each set of suit tiles contains four of each number, making a total of 36 tiles per suit. Players must learn to recognize and differentiate these tiles to form valid combinations during the game.

2. Honor Tiles:

Honor tiles include Wind tiles and Dragon tiles. There are four Wind tiles: East, South, West, and North, each represented by its respective Chinese character. Dragon tiles come in three colors: Red, Green, and White. There are four of each Wind and Dragon tile, totaling 16 Wind tiles and 12 Dragon tiles. These tiles are crucial for creating specific winning hands and often hold higher point values.

3. Bonus Tiles:

Bonus tiles consist of Flower tiles and Season tiles. There are four Flower tiles and four Season tiles, each representing different flowers and seasons. Unlike other tiles, there is only one of each Bonus tile. These tiles are not used in forming standard combinations but can provide extra points when drawn. When a player draws a Bonus tile, they usually set it aside and draw a replacement tile.

Each tile in the suit categories is numbered from one to nine, and each number appears four times in a complete set of tiles. The symbols on the tiles can seem complex at first, but they are essential for forming the required sets of three (called Pungs and Chows) or four (called Kongs) tiles and pairs needed to win the game.

Understanding these different types of tiles is the first step in mastering the mahjong game. Knowing how to identify and use each tile effectively will help you develop strategies and improve your gameplay.

Playing a mahjong game involves several steps, from setting up the game to completing a winning hand. Here is a simple guide to help you get started:

B. How to Play Mahjong Game

1. Setting Up the Game: To begin, players need a set of 144 tiles, which include Suit tiles, Honor tiles, and Bonus tiles. Each player starts by building a wall of tiles in front of them. Usually, it is 18 tiles long and two tiles high, forming a square wall in the center of the table. The dealer (often decided by rolling dice) then breaks the wall, and the game begins.

2. Drawing and Discarding Tiles: Each player starts with 13 tiles, except the dealer, who starts with 14 tiles. The game proceeds with the dealer discarding one tile to start the game. Players take turns drawing a tile from the wall and discarding a tile they don't need. The goal is to improve their hand by forming sets of tiles.

3. Forming Sets: To win a mahjong game, a player needs to form a complete hand, typically consisting of four sets and one pair. Sets can be:

  • Pung: Three identical tiles (e.g., three 5 Bamboos).

  • Chow: A sequence of three consecutive numbers in the same suit (e.g., 4, 5, and 6 Dots).

  • Kong: Four identical tiles (e.g., four Red Dragons), which also require an extra tile to be drawn as a replacement.

A pair is two identical tiles (e.g., two East Winds). Your goal is to be the first one that form a complete hand to win the game.

4. Declaring and Completing a Mahjong

When a player draws or discards a tile that completes their hand, they declare "Mahjong" and show their hand to confirm the winning combination. If the hand is valid, that player wins the game.

Mahjong can seem complicated at first, but with some practice and helpful tips, beginners can quickly improve their skills and enjoy the game more. Here are some tips to get you started:

C. Mahjong Game Tips for Beginners

1. Strategize and Avoid Rushing: Take your time to plan each move carefully. Quick decisions can hinder your chances of obtaining needed tiles or inadvertently benefit your opponents.

2. Keep Tiles Together: Resist the temptation to organize your tiles into sets prematurely. Revealing your hand can give opponents an advantage.

3. Focus on Available Tiles: Concentrate on matching and removing free tiles rather than being overly concerned with blocked ones.

4. Monitor Board Layout

Pay attention to the arrangement of tiles on the board. Changes in stacks and rows can impact your strategy and reveal or block new tiles.

5. Adapt Your Strategy: Stay flexible and adjust your approach if your initial plan isn't yielding results. Consider alternative methods such as shifting from tile matching to forming chows.

6. Anticipate Future Moves: Think ahead about the consequences of your actions. Consider how your decisions may influence your hand as the game progresses.

7. Delay Non-Advancing Moves: Avoid making moves that don't move your game forward. Wait for better opportunities to arise.

8. Note Tiles of the Same Symbol: When multiple identical tiles are available, assess each one's potential and the options they may unlock before making a move.

9. Learn Tile Symbols and Locations: Familiarize yourself with tile symbols and their positions to enhance your efficiency and accuracy in matching.

10. Unlock Tiles Regularly: Strive to unlock at least one tile with each move, even if it doesn't immediately create a pair. This approach keeps your options open and prevents getting stuck.

scraped_articles.title: US Senators Urge AI Lawsuits After Taylor Swift Deepfake Scandal
scraped_articles.meta_description: US Senators Urge AI Lawsuits After Taylor Swift Deepfake Scandal
scraped_articles.content:
US Senators Urge AI Lawsuits After Taylor Swift Deepfake Scandal

US Senators Urge AI Lawsuits After Taylor Swift Deepfake Scandal

A bipartisan group of US senators on Tuesday (30/1) introduced a bill that would criminalize the dissemination of non-consensual sexual images generated by artificial intelligence.

The move comes in direct response to the spread of AI-generated pornographic images of Taylor Swift on X in recent days.

The measure would allow victims depicted in nude or sexualized digital forgeries to sue for civil penalties.

Individuals who create or possess fakes and plan to distribute them or anyone who receives such material could face legal action.

According to the Guardian, Dick Durbin, the majority member of the US Senate as well as senators Lindsey Graham, Amy Klobuchar, and Josh Hawley are behind the bill.

The law is known as the Fake Image Editing and Non-Consensual Editing Act of 2024, or the "Defiance Act".

"This month, fake and sexually explicit images of Taylor Swift generated by artificial intelligence spread across social media platforms."

"While the images may be fake, the harm to victims from the distribution of sexually explicit deepfakes is very real," Durbin said in a press release.

Swift's overtly sexualized image at the soccer game went viral over the weekend on X, being viewed tens of millions of times, according to Twitter metrics.

AI-generated images or videos of real people, commonly known as deepfakes, have become increasingly common online as the barriers to creating such images or videos are lower.

Deepfakes have boomed amidst increased interest in artificial intelligence in recent years.

Some undress a person or paste a person's face on top of another person's face to portray the person saying something they didn't say, which is entirely generated by AI.

Swift's image was most likely created using Microsoft Designer and first shared on Telegram.

Microsoft introduced the changes to close a technical loophole that allowed the creation of the images.


"No one, neither celebrities nor ordinary Americans, should find themselves featured in AI pornography. Innocent people have the right to defend their reputation and hold perpetrators accountable in court. This bill will make that happen," Hawley said.

scraped_articles.title: Meet the New Māori Queen, Who Became Queen of New Zealand at the Age of 27
scraped_articles.meta_description: Ngā Wai Hono i te Pō Paki is only the second Māori Queen in history.
scraped_articles.content:
Meet the New Māori Queen, Who Became Queen of New Zealand at the Age of 27

She is only the second Māori Queen in history.

Meet the New Māori Queen, Who Became Queen of New Zealand at the Age of 27

New Queen

The new Māori queen, Ngā Wai Hono i te Pō Paki, was crowned on September 5, 2024.

She was crowned after her father, Kiingi Tūheitia Pōtatau Te Wherowhero VII, died.

Tuheitia Pootatau Te Wherowhero VII died at age 69.

He died after undergoing heart surgery just days after celebrating the 18th anniversary of his own coronation.

Source: NPR

Leaders announced on Thursday that they had chosen Nga Wai Hono i te Po. This made her the eighth Māori monarch and just the second queen.

Family 

Ngā Wai Hono i te Pō Paki was the youngest and only daughter of King Kiingi Tūheitia. 

Despite being the youngest, she was chosen by a council of New Zealand's Indigenous Māori chiefs to replace her father.

The position is not automatically passed down through the bloodline. Tribal delegates elect the position.

Education

She holds a bachelor's degree from the University of Waikato and a master's degree in Tikanga Māori, which covers Māori customs and practices.

She has also joined various boards focused on revitalizing the Māori language and culture.

Coronation Ceremony

Her coronation ceremony, known as Te Whakawahinga, is held at Tūrangawaewae Marae on the North Island of New Zealand.

The event was part of a six-day tangihanga (funeral) for Kiingi Tūheitia.

During the ceremony, she was given a Bible and holy oil to give her dignity, sanctity, authority, and spiritual essence.

scraped_articles.title: Meet Madison Marsh. US Fighter Pilot Winner of Miss America 2024
scraped_articles.meta_description: Meet Madison Marsh. US Fighter Pilot Winner of Miss America 2024
scraped_articles.content:
Meet Madison Marsh. US Fighter Pilot Winner of Miss America 2024

Meet Madison Marsh. US Fighter Pilot Winner of Miss America 2024

Madison Marsh was a United States fighter pilot crowned Miss America in 2024. The 22-year-old woman, a master's student at Harvard Kennedy School's public policy program, was crowned Miss America 2024 in Orlando on Sunday, January 14, 2024.

At the beauty pageant, she was a finalist from Colorado. "You can achieve anything. The sky is not the limit and the only person stopping you is yourself," Marsh said in an interview shared via Miss America's Instagram Story.

She noted that if she can come from "a small town, not be part of a pageant," and win the competition, others can too. Marsh, a second lieutenant in the US Air Force, is the first active-duty officer to receive the title.

Marsh, a second lieutenant in the US Air Force, is the first active-duty officer to receive the title.

Marsh succeeds Grace Stanke of Wisconsin, who is Miss America 2023. Stanke was also present to hand over the Miss America crown to her successor.

The US Air Force celebrated Marsh's victory in a tweet on X, where they called her "ours." There were 51 contestants representing the US states and the District of Columbia.

The jury pre-selected 10 contestants to enter the pageant, while the public voted for one contestant, resulting in 11 Miss America 2024 semifinalists. Before categorizing them into five finalists for this year's Miss America, the semifinalists participated in four rounds of competition.

The Miss America 2024 competition series included a fitness runway, a "hot topic" discussion, a talent show, and an evening gown presentation.

The finalists then spoke about their dreams and goals as Miss America.

Marsh revealed her mother's journey with pancreatic cancer as she spoke on the topic of drug discussion in America. In the talent show round, one is chosen to talk orally about receiving a pilot's license at 16.

Ahead of the contest, Marsh shared her motivation for taking part. Speaking to SWNS, according to the NY Post, she said, "It was an amazing experience to bring together both sides of my favorite part of my life and hopefully make a difference for other people to be able to realize that you don't have to limit yourself."


She continued, "In the military, it's an open space to really lead how you want to, both in and out of 'uniform.'"

"I feel like pageants, and specifically winning Miss Colorado, is a way to really set an example and set the tone to help make others feel more comfortable finding what matters most to them."

Marsh graduated from the Air Force Academy with a degree in physics and a focus on astronomy, reports ABC News. She is now pursuing a master's degree in public policy at Harvard Kennedy School, according to his competition biography.

In an interview with the university newspaper, The Harvard Crimson, Marsh said she sees similarities between military duty and beauty pageants, explaining that you're serving in different ways in both.

"When I'm in uniform, I'm serving and representing our country," she said. "When I'm wearing the crown and shawl, I'm serving, representing my community."

Marsh crowned Miss Colorado in May 2023, told the newspaper that she started competing in beauty pageants during her first year at the Air Force Academy. "I don't think I would have gotten into Harvard if I hadn't gone to the Air Force Academy," Marsh said.

"I don't think I would have been Miss Colorado without the Air Force Academy because they trained me and honed my leadership skills."

Marsh says she plans to dedicate her year of service as Miss America to raising awareness about pancreatic cancer.

The disease caused her mother's death.

Marsh's foundation for pancreatic cancer research and advocacy is named the Whitney Marsh Foundation in honor of her late mother.

"I really wanted to be able to spread awareness around pancreatic cancer and share my mom's story, and be able to fundraise and raise research funds for pancreatic cancer," Marsh said in her post-victory interview, which was shared on Miss America's Instagram Story.

She also said, "I'm really excited to represent women who can break stereotypes."

scraped_articles.title: Scientists Solve the Mystery of the Age of the Lala Lallia Star Sand Dunes in Morocco
scraped_articles.meta_description: Scientists Solve the Mystery of the Age of the Lala Lallia Star Sand Dunes in Morocco
scraped_articles.content:
Scientists Solve the Mystery of the Age of the Lala Lallia Star Sand Dunes in Morocco

Scientists Solve the Mystery of the Age of the Lala Lallia Star Sand Dunes in Morocco

Scientists have revealed that Morocco's star dunes, Lala Lallia, were formed 13,000 years ago. Star dunes are created by opposing winds that change direction.

"Knowing their age can help scientists understand the wind and reveal the climate of the time," said Prof. Geoff Duller from Aberystwyth University, who published the study with Prof. Charles Bristow from Birkbeck University.

Lala Lallia, located in the Erg Chebbi sand sea in southeastern Morocco, has been called the most complex in the world. It is 100m high, while its width is 700m.

After its initial formation, Lala Lallia stopped growing for about 8,000 years and expanded rapidly in the last few thousand years.

Usually, deserts can be identified in the Earth's geological history, but stellar sand dunes only exist now.

Prof Duller says this may be because they are so large that experts must realize they are looking at different dunes.

"This finding will probably surprise a lot of people because we can see how quickly these large dunes form and they move across the desert at about 50 cm per year," he added.

Scientists used luminescence dating to determine the age of the stellar sand dunes. The method calculates when the sand grains were last exposed to sunlight.

Sand samples were taken in the dark from Morocco and analyzed in a laboratory under dim red light conditions similar to an ancient photography workshop.

Prof. Duller describes the mineral grains in the sand as "tiny rechargeable batteries". They store energy inside the crystals from radioactivity in the natural environment.

The longer the sand is buried underground, the more radioactivity it is exposed to and the more energy it collects.

When the grains are exposed in the lab, they release energy in the form of light, and scientists can calculate their age.

"In our dark laboratory, we see the light from these sand grains. The brighter the light, the older the sediment grains are and the longer they have been buried," says Prof. Duller.

Other large dunes include the Star Dune in Colorado, United States, which is the tallest dune in the US. Star Dune measures 225m from base to peak.

Climbing a dune, explains Prof. Duller, requires hard work.

"When you climb, you go up twice and back once. But it's worth it - everything is so beautiful when viewed from the top," he says.

Star dunes - or pyramid dunes - are named after their characteristic shape and reach hundreds of meters in height.

They are found in Africa, Asia, North America, and on Mars, but experts have never been able to date when they formed.
